name: Panch Phoron
description: A traditional Bengali five-spice blend made of fennel, nigella, cumin, fenugreek, and mustard seeds.

name: Shorshe Gura
description: Ground mustard seeds used for making tangy mustard pastes and curries, a staple in Bengali fish dishes.

name: Jeera Gura
description: Fragrant ground cumin, essential in Bengali curries and vegetable dishes for earthy depth.

name: Dhone Gura
description: Mild and citrusy coriander powder, used widely for both vegetarian and non-veg Bengali recipes.

name: Lanka Gura
description: Fiery red chili powder to spice up dal, meat, and fried snacks—handle with care!

name: Gorom Masala
description: A warm, aromatic blend of cardamom, cinnamon, cloves and more—used at the end of cooking for rich flavor.

name: Ada Rosun Bata
description: A freshly ground mix of ginger and garlic, used as the base for most Bengali curries.

name: Tejpata
description: Dried bay leaves used in tempering rice, lentils, and biryani for a subtle aromatic kick.

name: Chili Flakes
description: Crushed dried chilies used for pickles, stir-fries, or to add heat to snacks.

name: Halud Gura
description: Golden yellow turmeric powder, adds color and health benefits to all Bengali meals.
